events.title: Michelangelo's The Last Judgment Unveiled
events.description: Michelangelo's fresco The Last Judgment on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City was unveiled to the public.
events.significance: This monumental work of Renaissance art influenced Western art and religious imagery significantly.

events.title: Lisbon Earthquake
events.description: A massive earthquake struck Lisbon, Portugal, causing widespread destruction and fires, followed by a tsunami and an epidemic.
events.significance: One of the deadliest earthquakes in history, it had profound effects on European philosophy and the development of seismology.

events.title: Bulgaria Declares Independence from the Ottoman Empire
events.description: Bulgaria proclaimed its independence from Ottoman rule, becoming a sovereign nation.
events.significance: Marked the decline of Ottoman influence in the Balkans and the rise of Bulgarian nationalism.

events.title: The United States Tests the First Hydrogen Bomb
events.description: The United States conducted the first successful test of a hydrogen bomb, codenamed 'Ivy Mike,' on Enewetak Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.
events.significance: Represented a significant escalation in nuclear weapons technology during the Cold War.

events.title: The Maastricht Treaty Comes Into Effect
events.description: The Maastricht Treaty officially established the European Union and set the stage for the introduction of the euro currency.
events.significance: A major step towards European integration with lasting political and economic implications.
